summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, addressing the defendant's motions for reconsideration and setting deadlines for government responses. It also provides scheduling details for jury selection, including when juror names will be disclosed and when peremptory challenges will occur.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case who has filed motions for reconsideration that are being addressed in this order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this order, setting deadlines for government responses and providing jury selection scheduling information.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Maxwell and issuing procedural orders.

events.title: Juror Names Disclosure
events.description: The court will provide lawyers with the names of jurors prior to the commencement of the voir dire process.

events.title: Peremptory Strikes
events.description: The court confirms that peremptory strikes will be exercised on this date, with 40 qualified jurors needed.

events.title: Government Response Deadline (Motion 407)
events.description: The government is ordered to respond to defendant's motion for reconsideration regarding disclosure of juror names.

events.title: Government Response Deadline (Motion 408)
events.description: The government is ordered to respond to defendant's other motion for reconsideration.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Judge Alison J. Nathan issued an order addressing Ghislaine Maxwell's motions for reconsideration in her criminal case.
The court set deadlines for government responses to Maxwell's motions for reconsideration (November 4 and November 8, 2021).
Juror names will be provided to lawyers on November 16, 2021, prior to voir dire.
Peremptory strikes in the jury selection process are scheduled for November 29, 2021, with the court seeking to qualify 50-60 prospective jurors.
The document indicates ongoing pretrial proceedings and jury selection logistics in the Maxwell criminal case.
